title: 108_hr3514
content: The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including US Tract 121, Sheffield ranger residence (0.41 acres), US Tract 896, undeveloped administrative site (2.42 acres), and US Tract 1047, original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters (4.90 acres). The Marienville Ranger District Headquarters, depicted on the map titled "Marienville Ranger Station Compound Tract 1047, August 1998", and US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence, depicted on the map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936", are subject to conveyance. The maps serve as the primary descriptions of the lands, with the map descriptions taking precedence over metes and bounds descriptions unless the map cannot be located. The maps are available for public inspection. The lands subject to conveyance are described in maps available for public inspection. Recipients may convey other land or make cash equalization payments as consideration. Applicable law governs the conveyance process. The conveyance of land under this section is subject to laws and regulations applicable to the National Forest System. The Secretary may prioritize public entities for land recipients and can set terms and conditions for offers, rejecting any that do not meet requirements. The Secretary may reject offers not meeting requirements or not in the public interest. Upon land conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. Additional terms may be imposed to protect US interests. SEC. 3. Conveyance of Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, Warren County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, 5.50 acres, to Warren County Development Association for $100,000. The map serves as the primary description of the lands. The map serves as the definitive description of the lands and is available for public inspection until disposal. Upon land conveyance by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. SEC. 4. CONVEYANCE OF RIDGEWAY RANGER DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS, ELK COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for fair market value as determined by an appraisal. The maps serve as the primary description of the lands being conveyed. The maps serve as the definitive description of the lands being conveyed. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked upon conveyance by the Secretary. SEC. 5. CONVEYANCE OF MARIENVILLE RANGER RESIDENCE, FOREST COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936" identifies the area as Lot 2 on the Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller on December 12, 1999. The map serves as the primary description of the lands, and in case of conflict with metes and bounds description, the map prevails unless it cannot be located. The map is available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until the lands are disposed. The map will be available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales and exchanges under section 2, as well as consideration received under sections 3(b) and 4(b) into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds can be used for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and sites in the Allegheny National Forest, or for acquiring land and interests in land within the forest. Land acquisition using these funds is subject to the condition of the market value of the acquired lands. Acquired lands in Allegheny National Forest using funds deposited must not exceed 125% of the market value of lands disposed of under this Act. SEC. 7. Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other relevant laws. The boundaries of Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition. SEC. 8. Relation to other conveyances authorities. SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act shall not be subject to certain provisions of title 40, United States Code.
